isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - INSTALL - SLEEPER CAB REAR CAB AIR SUSPENSION system

svcproc.title: SLEEPER CAB REAR CAB AIR SUSPENSION system

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to Figure 102
for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system contains one air spring (bag) strut module (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 102)
needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 4), fitting (Item 5), tee fitting (Item 6), air spring strut module (Item 2), height control valve (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air spring strut module (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 102)
for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve ON Sleeper Cab

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 102) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 103
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 4) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 15) on rear side of drive bearing (Item 14) is located on "SUPPLY" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 13), but not remove, and pull height control valve arm (Item 11) loose from drive bearing (Item 14). Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 102
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 3) on mounting bracket on frame rail.

Install two hex head bolts with washers (Item 10) thru height control valve and mounting bracket and install hex lock nuts (Item 10). Tighten hex head bolts and hex lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (10.8 to 13.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 103
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 4) on height control valve mounting bracket (Item 14) and install two hex head bolts, washers and hex lock nuts (Items 10). Tighten hex head bolts and hex lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (10.8 to 13.6 N•m).

Position height control valve linkage (Item 6) at height control valve arm (Item 9). Install hex head link bolt with washer (Item 7) through height control valve linkage and height control valve arm and install hex nut (Item 7).

Push air line (susp) (Item 5) into release collet (Item 1) of tee fitting (Item 2) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4) to passenger side air spring strut module (Item 2) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

Push air line (susp) (Item 5) into release collet (Item 1) of tee fitting (Item 2) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 4) to driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

Push air line (supply) (Item 3) into release collet (Item 1) of height control valve fitting "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 4) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring Strut Module on Sleeper Cab

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 102
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) as follows.

step2.para: Position top plate of driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) over threaded studs (Item 9) of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Position cab strut strap assembly (Item 12) under top plate of driver side air spring strut module (Item 2).
Install four hex flanged nuts (Item 19) onto threaded studs (Item 9) of cab mounting plate (Item 1). Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Position strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail. Install four hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged nuts (Items 14 and 15).

Position cab strut strap assembly (Item 12) at strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail and install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 16 and hex flanged nuts (Items 17). Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

Push air line (susp) (Item 4) into release collet (Item 1) of fitting (Item 5) of driver side air spring strut module (Item 2) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

step1.para: Install passenger side air spring strut module (Item 2) as follows.

step2.para: Position top plate of passenger side air spring strut module (Item 2) over threaded studs (Item 9) of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Position cab strut strap assembly (Item 12) under top plate of passenger side air spring strut module (Item 2).
Install four hex flanged nuts (Item 19) onto threaded studs (Item 9) of cab mounting plate (Item 1). Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Position strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail. Install four hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged nuts (Items 14 and 15).

Position cab strut strap assembly (Item 12) at strut adjust support (Item 11) at the frame rail and install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 16 and hex flanged nuts (Items 17). Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

Push air line (susp) (Item 4) into release collet (Item 1) of fitting (Item 5) of passenger side air spring strut module (Item 2) until it bottoms, push air line in again to make sure air line is inserted past collet and O-ring then pull on air line to check engagement of release collet.

step1.para: Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.
